description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7eqlp","text":"Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISAs) were performed to detect Borrelia spp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uc7i","text":"(B. afzelii, B. garinii, and B. burgdorferi sensu stricto) using an Anti-Borrelia Plus VlsE ELISA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2va8","text":"for IgG kit (Euroimmun AG, Aktiengesellschaft, Lübeck, Germany).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbn3d","text":"Sample incubation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eslub","text":"(1st step)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l53v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlls5","text":"Transfer 100 µl of the diluted serum samples. One serum sample per well. Incubate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m0r4","text":"at room temperature (+18 0 C to +25 0 C) for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qja9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch5dq","text":"Washing: Aspirate off the liquid from each well and wash 3 times each with 450µl working-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frdnb","text":"strength universal buffer on a rocking shaker. Leave the wash buffer in each well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erggq","text":"for 30 to 60 seconds per washing cycle, and then empty the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39m43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kq0h","text":"Conjugate incubation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3jc3","text":"(2nd step)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cumg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fcjv","text":"Pipette 100 µl ready for use diluted enzyme conjugate (peroxidase-labelled anti-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nnlr","text":"human-IgG) into each of the microplate wells. Incubate for 30 minutes at room","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr6m2","text":"temperature (+18 0 C to +25 0 C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37tqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btif7","text":"Washing: Aspirate off the liquid from each well. Wash as described above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28ga","text":"Substrate incubation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ecil","text":"(3 rd step)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71u3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kab4","text":"Pipette 100µl chromogen/substrate solution into the channels of the incubation tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vob9","text":"Incubate for 15 minutes at room temperature (+18 0 C to +25 0 C), protect from","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g9oa","text":"sunlight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cca3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jtu6","text":"Stopping: Aspirate off the liquid from each well and pipette 100µl of stop solution into of the","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvk0h","text":"microplate wells in the same order and same speed as the chromogen/substrate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u00j","text":"solution was introduced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o6vt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3iio","text":"Evaluation: Results should be read once strips have dried.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr535","text":"Adjust the ELISA Microwell Plate Reader to zero using the substrate blank in well A1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k5ap","text":"If - due to technical reasons - the ELISA reader cannot be adjusted to zero using the substrate blank in well A1,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt7pt","text":"subtract the absorbance value of well A1 from all other absorbance values measured in order to obtain reliable","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ja5u","text":"results!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36ino","text":"Measure the absorbance of all wells at 450 nm and record the absorbance values for each control and patient","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gshj","text":"sample in the distribution and identification plan.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a789c","text":"Dual wavelength reading using 620 nm as reference wavelength is recommended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"976d","text":"Where applicable calculate the mean absorbance values of all duplicates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3eaq5","text":"In order for an assay to be considered valid, the following criteria must be met:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vnmf","text":" Negative Control \u003c 0.2 absorbance units","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtluf","text":" Positive Control \u003e 0.8 absorbance units","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t6mo","text":" Cutoff Calibrator 0.25-0.55 absorbance units","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4nao","text":" Cutoff Calibrator / Negative Control ratio \u003e 1.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vq0n","text":" Positive Control / Cutoff Calibrator ratio \u003e 2.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abli2","text":"The cut-off is the mean absorbance value of the Cut-off control determinations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f61j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oqdm","text":"Example: Absorbance value Cut-off control 0.54 + absorbance value Cut-off control 0.52 =1.06 / 2 = 0.53","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dih95","text":"Cut-off = 0.53","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v2b1","text":"Samples are considered POSITIVE if the absorbance value is higher than 10% over the cut-off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"975j","text":"Samples with an absorbance value of 10% above or below the cut-off should not be considered as clearly positive or","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5iuga","text":"negative","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rtjt","text":" grey zone","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dto1n","text":"It is recommended to repeat the test again 2 - 4 weeks later with a fresh sample. If results in the second test are again","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36cr1","text":"in the grey zone the sample has to be considered NEGATIVE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b006","text":"Samples are considered NEGATIVE if the absorbance value is lower than 10% below the cut-off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Anti-Borrelia ELISA (IgG)
